required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy Skills Group Pilot Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy Skills Group Pilot Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: Uncontrolled pilot study examines feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary efficacy of Dialectical Behavior Therapy skills group for Veterans with suicidal ideation and emotion dysregulation.

detailed_description.textblock: Uncontrolled pilot study to examine feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary efficacy of Dialectical Behavior Therapy skills group for Veterans with suicidal ideation and emotion dysregulation. Outcome measures will occur at pre-treatment, mid, end, and follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility as Assessed by Attendance at Sessions for Duration of Intervention (Percent of Sessions Attended)
primary_outcome.description: Participation in skills group as assessed by attendance at sessions for duration of intervention (percent of sessions attended)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability as Assessed by Positive Feedback on Written Satisfaction Evaluations Completed by Participants at Mid-point of Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability to participants on the "Client Satisfaction Scale" created for this study. Participants rated group satisfaction on 11 items using 7point scale. Scale is scored by calculating mean of the 11 items. Scale range is 1-7. A higher score indicates greater satisfaction; a lower score indicates greater dissatisfaction, with 4 as the midpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability as Assessed by Positive Feedback on Written Satisfaction Evaluations Completed by Participants at Post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability to participants on the "Client Satisfaction Scale" created for this study. Participants rated group satisfaction on 11 items using 7point scale. Scale is scored by calculating mean of the 11 items. Scale range is 1-7. A higher score indicates greater satisfaction; a lower score indicates greater dissatisfaction, with 4 as the midpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability as Assessed by Positive Feedback on Written Satisfaction Evaluations Completed by Participants at Follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability to participants on the "Client Satisfaction Scale" created for this study. Participants rated group satisfaction on 11 items using 7point scale. Scale is scored by calculating mean of the 11 items. Scale range is 1-7. A higher score indicates greater satisfaction; a lower score indicates greater dissatisfaction, with 4 as the midpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Suicidal Ideation on Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire at 3months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 92. Higher score indicates greater suicidal ideation; lower score indicates lower suicidal ideation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Suicidal Ideation on Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire at 6months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 92. Higher score indicates greater suicidal ideation; lower score indicates lower suicidal ideation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Suicidal Ideation on Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire at 9months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 92. Higher score indicates greater suicidal ideation; lower score indicates lower suicidal ideation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotion Dysregulation as Assessed Using Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale at 3months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS). Scale range: 36-180. Higher score indicates greater difficulties regulating emotions. Lower score indicates fewer difficulties regulating emotions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotion Dysregulation as Assessed Using Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale at 6months (End of Intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS). Scale range: 36-180. Higher score indicates greater difficulties regulating emotions. Lower score indicates fewer difficulties regulating emotions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotion Dysregulation as Assessed Using Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale at 9months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS). Scale range: 36-180. Higher score indicates greater difficulties regulating emotions. Lower score indicates fewer difficulties regulating emotions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Coping as Assessed With the DBT (Dialectical Behavior Therapy) Ways of Coping Checklist at 3months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy Ways of Coping Checklist (DBT-WCCL) effective coping subscale. Minimum score: 0. Maximum score: 3. Higher score indicates more frequent use of adaptive coping strategies. Lower score indicates less frequent use of adaptive coping strategies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Coping as Assessed With the DBT Ways of Coping Checklist at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy Ways of Coping Checklist (DBT-WCCL) effective coping subscale. Minimum score: 0. Maximum score: 3. Higher score indicates more frequent use of adaptive coping strategies. Lower score indicates less frequent use of adaptive coping strategies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Coping as Assessed With the DBT Ways of Coping Checklist at 9months
secondary_outcome.description: Scale title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy Ways of Coping Checklist (DBT-WCCL) effective coping subscale. Minimum score: 0. Maximum score: 3. Higher score indicates more frequent use of adaptive coping strategies. Lower score indicates less frequent use of adaptive coping strategies.

intervention.description: Skills training in emotion regulation, distress tolerance, interpersonal effectiveness, and mindfulness

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Veterans at VACHS who are referred or self-referred to DBT Skills Group
2. Ages 18-65
3. Able to understand written and spoken English
4. DERS score 105 or greater
5. Suicidal ideation within past 3 months
6. Seeing an individual mental health provider at VACHS at least monthly
7. Willing to create or review a Mental Health Safety Plan, and stated willingness to use this plan to maintain safety
8. Consent to participate in study assessments
9. Consent to recording of group sessions
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Inability to understand written or spoken English
2. Diagnosis of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, bipolar I, antisocial personality disorder, or thought disorder in CPRS problem list and confirmed by current mental health provider

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

measure.title: Suicidal Ideation on Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire at 3months
measure.description: Scale title: Suicidal Behavior Questionnaire. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 92. Higher score indicates greater suicidal ideation; lower score indicates lower suicidal ideation.
measure.population: 17 participants started the study; 15 provided scores on this measure at 3month assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is that there is no difference between baseline assessment and this 3-month assessment.
analysis.p_value_desc: a priori threshold for significance adjusted to p = .016 for multiple comparisons

group.title: Skills Group

event.description: psychiatric hospitalization in a participant who had previously dropped out of study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Some missing data in assessments due to attrition; planned absence of control arm for this small open feasibility pilot trial; absence of adherence coding due to logistical constraints
